body: Will review...
@olegz thanks for reviewing! Just a heads up - I pushed a new commit to address some RAT exclusions and checkstyle violations -- i had forgotten to run the -Pcontrib-check before creating the PR.

I added a [gist](https://gist.github.com/mattyb149/bc601d0d00409922e788c0d4e5f8b0e2) with a couple of use cases as well (branching w random delay, and multiple Split processors).

I left a few minor comments, overall it looks and works great, very well designed and concise clear code. Great work!
@mattyb149 Glad to hear that EnforceOrderProcessor works for your use-cases. I'll fix the typos and apply suggested changes. Thanks!
+1 looks good, will merge to master
+1 looks good, verified the tests pass now

For dear reviewer(s), I've put template files and description on how it works in this [Gist](https://gist.github.com/ijokarumawak/e552885a29c53ce60012cacef62a3342), please take a look on it, too. Thanks a lot in advance!
Reviewing...
Thanks @mcgilman this has been merged to master!
@francoisprunier sorry for the delay in responding.  Will try to come back to this soon!
@apiri?
checkstyle violations and when attempting to view an Avro object i got "Unable to generate view of data: Not a data file."
Sorry for the delay @WilliamNouet . I am going to look at it now.
@mattyb149 I've incorporated your comments. Thanks for reviewing!
@joewitt, I've applied your patch and pushed it, we should be good to go.

@bbende 
Ready for another review! I've updated per your comments and added some unit tests.
Shouldn't `static final AllowableValue MODE_MULTIFILE` ... be updated to reflect new behavior?
ok @olegz @mattyb149 I have submitted a new commit that addresses all of the feedback above.

@markap14 I'll take care of the checkstyle issue and i figured out what i was doing wrong.  It was avro without the schema.  We obviously cannot do much for that at this point.  Avro w/schema works great.  +1 will merge shortly

http://jsfiddle.net/Ldr07h2r/6/

@trixpan sorry, been traveling and have had a bit of a hectic schedule.  would you please be able to rebase and then I will look to get this closed out in the next day or so?
forget it. Seen what @mcgilman was referring to. Possible to play with text area but it becomes single line. :-(
no worries. rebased

@aperepel Integration tests are written for the processors, but aren't included in the build.  There should probably be some tests that do get run with the build, using the TestRunner.  The CloudStorageAccount would have to be mocked, which at a minimum you could do by making an extension of the class under test in which the createStorageAccount method used by the test returns a mock.

@brianburnett there's a minor conflict but I am more concerned with consistent failures when I run the test units?

Have you been able to build this with `-Pcontrib-check` ?

@jdye64 can you please solve the conflicts?

Cheers!
@trixpan I tried talking it out but that didn't seem to solve the conflict?? Will try more forceful procedures when I get off the road and near a computer ;) thanks for taking a look at this!
+1 LGTM, ran with the latest, full build and a number of use cases. All looks great, thanks very much! Merging to master
:rofl:
@ijokarumawak sorry for the delay but it seems this needs rebasing. :-(

@brosander are you still planning to review this at some stage? Happy to try to help if needed.

Cheers!
@brosander sorry for the delay but now it seems like this PR has merge conflicts.
@ijokarumawak thanks for fixing this. merged
@jfrazee we can remove it from the assembly notice too.  I took out the flume twitter source on the 1.x line already.  That NIFI-3018 JIRA is for the 0.x line.  I'll take care of that on the merge.

The commit which removed the properties/skip javadoc/src does need to be in the nar bundle itself.  We dont want src/javadocs for the nar bundle.  Also, the processor needs a name that follows the pattern of VerbSubject instead of GroovyX.

We will definitely need unit tests for this.  There are references to Oracle things in there or at least in the screenshot.  The LICENSE and NOTICE appears to have a lot of copy/paste from other nars.  Are all those dependencies really there?
Reviewing...

@joewitt, the license, notice, and dependency changes look good to me:
* Builds good
* Works good - tested a Google Cloud Storage flow in which put, list, fetch, and delete all worked.
* Confirmed that the nifi-gcp-nar contains json using com.tdunning:json under ASLv2, not the json.org version.

I will merge shortly.
+1 LGTM ran a full build with unit tests and contrib-check, tried various RecordReaders and Writers and QueryFlowFile queries, great work!  Merging to master
@trixpan I fixed the conflicts by refactoring some code that had changed due to NIFI-3204 #1561
Glad you managed to get the  lines out of their conflict...  will review

From a first look the code seems ok but I have a quick question:

Do we truly need a permission denied relationship? It seems like a deviation from the general nature of failure relationships (generally they are nearly all encompassing). 

Perhaps we could add the failure reason to an attribute and route to failure? 

Reason I ask is that I like the strong similarity between the *HDFS, the *File and *S3 processors and I suspect this change would introduce change that will move some of them appart?

My reasoning for adding the extra relationship was for end users to understand that certain directories or files had improper permissions and have a visible way to see that with the extra relationship. However your right we could just add something like a "error.code" and "error.message" attributes and route to failure. I would like the "error.code" for sure however since that would be easy to route against while error.message might contain different messages from the exceptions when dependency versions change
Thanks guys. This has been merged to master.
+1 LGTM, merging to master, thanks!

@joewitt , about naming: CallGroovy would be fine?
Actually it's another implementation of groovy script. 
And the Script processor is just a Script - and not CallScript.
I wanted to point that it's extended groovy script.. What do you think about the name?

Hi @mcgilman,

I strongly agree on your point that need to introduce new attribute of `PropetyDescriptor` which would drive whether or not to use a masked single line input or the existing multi-line `textarea`. Our focus is only on properties that require user to enter password. All sensitive properties need not be a password property. And password properties are supposed to be single line and should not support expression-language. (Also i believe password boxes cannot be created without `<input type="password">`)

Also understand the impact that you mentioned - 

> There exists sensitive properties that currently expect the field to support multi-line input. The input[type=password] only supports a single line.

I am willing to contribute.. Would be great if you could suggest some good place for me to look for impact...
Reviewing...
All look good to me. Merged into master. Thanks!

For the keystore, truststores in test resources, is it possible we could use the tls-toolkit to generate those on demand?

https://github.com/apache/nifi-minifi/blob/master/minifi-c2/minifi-c2-integration-tests/src/test/java/org/apache/nifi/minifi/c2/integration/test/AbstractTestSecure.java#L71

That should keep them from expiring or needing to be changed later.
Would it be difficult to create the other binary resources in test setup?  If not it might be preferable to having zips and tars in source control.
We may want to add some usage information to the documentation as well.

Hey @YolandaMDavis this looks like a really good addition to the nifi toolkit!  Being able to send bulletins and manage nodes via the command line will likely be a really nice-to-have feature for admins.

Put feedback above.  Please let me know if you need more info.
An end-to-end flow can be time-consuming to set up, I have a template [as a Gist here](https://gist.github.com/mattyb149/1ebdbff9ea48f36f5a5f007b191e8f8b).
@brosander thanks so much for reviewing! Concerning documentation I do have a link attached. Will also look at the code changes you suggested.
@joewitt I will take a look, thanks!

Thanks for this @jvwing.  Would you mind updating the nifi-nar-bundles/nifi-aws-bundle/nifi-aws-nar/src/main/resources/META-INF/NOTICE and nifi-assembly/NOTICE files to remove the 1 line from each that says "JSON parsing and utility functions from JSON.org - Copyright 2002 JSON.org" in the Amazon Web Services SDK section?  If you could take care of that in this PR, then I won't need another!

@mosermw, sorry I left that out.  I updated both NOTICE files and checked the [AWS SDK NOTICE](https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-java/blob/master/NOTICE.txt) to verify that was the only change.  I force pushed the branch with the modified commit.
Sorry for the late answer @trixpan, just coming back from holidays. You're right, I should update the description, will do it later today. Thanks!

changes look good, L&N looks correct for added deps.

will get this merged, thanks!

LGTM, the processor runs great, I created a [template on Gist](https://gist.github.com/mattyb149/216f295e9237b09907fa62fa0c099afe) with a bunch of examples (Avro, JSON, and CSV). +1 pending any incorporated changes suggested above.

It looks like I should also migrate the changes from NIFI-2763 and NIFI-2902 (V4 Signer support) over to the 0.x branch as well, to avoid breaking that functionality.  I will create a new JIRA for that.
Would you close this PR @jvwing?  Thank you.
Thanks, @mosermw.
Thanks @ijokarumawak this has been merged to master!
Just pushed a commit to address your comment let me know if you want me to squash the PR.

Updated:
- Rebased with the latest master, conflicts are resolved
- Incorporated NIFI-3162: RPG configurations Audit with newly added batch configs
- Incorporated NIFI-3163: Flow Fingerprint with newly added batch configs

Retest load distribution in 3 node NiFi cluster. Confirmed batch settings are taking effect.
This PR is ready for review! Thank you :)

@mcgilman looks good. I agree with the logic change and code looks clean. Everything appears to still work well. Merged to master.
+1 LGTM, merging to master, thanks!
@dlukyanov That is not your fault -- @mattyb149 is fixing it in [NIFI-3718](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NIFI-3718).

I recommend ExecuteGroovyScript as the name, it seems to support the same use case as ExecuteScript but with Groovy-specific bells and whistles. I haven't had a time to review in depth, but will soon.
Merging based on Travis tests passing

We have avro schema as the basis for carrying the schema data for readers and writers but appear not to use the concept of defaults.  We should take advantage of that for reading/writing.  Same for aliases presumably.  This also increases the opportunity to have a reading schema and a writing schema match up based on aliases.

Hmm, would this be a problem with Update Keys in general, or only Primary Keys when Update Keys are not specified? Either way, should we be including (and expecting) last_value when the statement type is update?
dont love all the whitespace adjustments to pom.xml but it does correct some formatting issues.  full build/contrib check clear. +1 will merge to master

Reduced nar file size from 67MB to 14MB by removing hadoop-common and atlas type system. The classes needed in Atlas type system for Atlas client v2 was in atlas-intg and atlas-common. It works correctly so far. Please let me know anything found, thank you!
@ijokarumawak can you go ahead and squash these.  Thanks for getting it down to 13MB for the nar.  Much better!
doesnt quite look like all L&N considerations for the nar have been addressed.  please update
@joewitt Thanks for pointing that out. I will update NOTICE.

@joewitt Added L&N. I hope I've done it correctly. Please check.
BTW, [SmartBear has acquired Reverb technologies](https://smartbear.com/news/news-releases/sponsorship-of-swagger/) and its copyright has been changed to [SmartBear Software](https://github.com/swagger-api/swagger-core/blob/master/LICENSE). nifi-assembly and nifi-framework-nar still have 'Copyright 2015 Reverb Technologies, Inc.' in their NOTICE file. Should we update those, too?
Reviewing...
Thanks for rebasing... Will review

So far the changes look good. One suggestion I'd like to offer is rendering something in this batch settings when there is nothing configured. Typically, we use a string like 'No value set' or relay this fact.

![screen shot 2017-04-20 at 9 48 13 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/123395/25234100/1408ecb6-25af-11e7-8eda-412cd515871b.png)

Have we considered providing default values for any of the batch settings? We effectively already have that for the duration but the user is only aware of that through the tooltip. Maybe the default value for the duration is 500 millis?

I've updated the PR and changed how those processors handle failed input FlowFile after it had processed other inputs successfully within the same onTrigger process session. In short, "Put the failed FlowFile back into its input queue then discontinue."

[Gist](https://gist.github.com/ijokarumawak/e552885a29c53ce60012cacef62a3342) is also updated to illustrate what will happen with default behavior and enabled 'Rollback on Failure'.

Any feedback is appreciated. Thanks!

@brosander I've chatted with @thesolson about documentation and she was willing to help there.  She will create a separate request in Jira for that effort to add admin-toolkit info to the admin guide.
@alopresto thanks so much for your feedback. I've made changes for your review.
